TCP

Class RTDBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • TCP.RTDBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RDT10, RDT20, RDT21, RDT22, RDT30

    public abstract class RTDBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The base class for each of the RTD simulations
    Since:
    2015-10-30
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    rms

    • Constructor Detail

      • RTDBase

        protected RTDBase(double pmunge,
                  double plost,
                  java.lang.String filename)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs the RTDBase class with forward and backward channels
        Parameters:
        pmunge - Probability (value in [0 to 1]) that a character is altered during transmission
        plost - Probability that a message is lost
        filename - File in current user directory used for automatic data feed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file open fails

      • RTDBase

        protected RTDBase(double pmunge,
                  double plost,
                  java.lang.String filename,
                  int interval)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs the RTDBase class with forward and backward channels
        Parameters:
        pmunge - Probability (value in [0 to 1]) that a character is altered during transmission
        plost - Probability that a message is lost
        filename - File in current user directory used for automatic data feed
        interval - Interval, in milleseconds between data feeds if automatic data feed is used
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file open fails

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts threads in forward, backward, sender, receiver and sp.

        public static java.lang.Object[] argParser(java.lang.String prog,
                                           java.lang.String[] args)
        Universal argument parser for all simulators
        Parameters:
        prog - Simulation program name
        args - Arguments passed to main
        Returns:
        Array containing -m, -l, -t and -f argument values
